primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transmission of the Word of God and the legacy of grace from the departing preacher to the congregation and successor, framed within the cosmic authority of the biblical canon.

subject.identificatie: The Word of God / The Preacher (as steward)
tekstueel_bewijs: it is meant to handle us
The gospel was meant to surround our minds and carry them captive
I have preached up and down the world

object.identificatie: The Grace of the Lord Jesus Christ / The integrity of the Word
tekstueel_bewijs: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all
the words of the prophecy of this book
God who called me to this work
God shall add unto him the plagues
I leave to my successor... the promise of his Savior
I give them now to you in parting

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (Comforter), Family, and the Congregation's expectancy
tekstueel_bewijs: the old promise of the sent Comforter
you have made me a better preacher
helper.rol_van_god: God is both the Sender and the Helper through the Spirit.

tegenstander.identificatie: Human vanity, secular acclaim, and the 'Tempter'
tekstueel_bewijs: tawdry, perishing prizes of public honor
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but the 'tempter' and the spiritual danger of tampering with the Word, which carries eternal consequences (Book of Life).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The congregation's continued 'march' toward glory after the preacher's departure.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Congregation (Old Concord Church)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Bright Glory / The sweet fields of Eden
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (the church's perseverance) is the result of the primary program (the reception of the Word and Grace).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God shall add unto him the plagues
God will give the garment of praise
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I have but skimmed the surface
We are told... not to tamper
I leave to all who feel weary

voorbeelden: not to tamper with the Word of God
must come to terms with the truth
Some of us want the Bible cut down
I felt I had preached all I knew
a mode of reasoning and expression
enable my preaching to be welcomed
the gospel... will [surround our minds] if we open ourselves

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the 'Must' of biblical integrity and the 'Must' of the preacher's duty, but grounds the 'Can' (Pouvoir) in the agency of the Word itself.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the danger of S2 (Judgment for tampering) to the necessity of S1 (The Grace of Jesus) as the only legacy.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through the 'Grace of the Lord Jesus' which is the final word of the canon and the sermon.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the preacher explicitly mentions 'shuddering' at the warnings of Revelation.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the preacher is the subject of many verbs, he positions himself as a conduit. The 'engine' of the sermon is the agency of the Word and the sufficiency of Grace.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: it will [surround our minds] if we open ourselves

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Active Subject in Salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God will give the garment of praise

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The preacher uses himself as a model of stewardship, but immediately deflects credit to God and the Word.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: John (as the one leaving a testament)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Christ as the True Witness who does not tamper with the Father's Word.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Comfort and a sense of being part of a larger, ongoing divine movement.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is presented as a gift (legacy) to be received, not a work to be achieved.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the preacher's personal history to the biblical warnings and finally to the benedictions is structurally seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'stern warning' of the Law and the 'earnest wish' of Grace.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: I came to Jesus, and I drank... now I live in him.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (Comforter) provides the competence (Pouvoir) for the Word to be received.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; tampering with the Word leads to removal from the Book of Life.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/The Word as the primary Subject of power, even while the preacher is the primary Subject of the narrative delivery.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer might identify too much with the 'preacher's success' rather than the 'Word's power'.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: The 'Thirsty One' who stoops to drink.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the helplessness of the 'thirsty' more than the 'expectancy' of the listener.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on how the Grace mentioned at the end actually enables the 'Marching on' commanded.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Grace) clearly precedes and empowers the Ethics (Marching on).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of a 'farewell' sermon that avoids narcissism by making the Word of God the true Subject of the preacher's career.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the pathos of the 'farewell'; actantial analysis reveals the preacher is actually subordinating his 'I' to the 'Word'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the context of Revelation 22; semiotics shows how the preacher uses that text to construct a 'legacy' actant.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'Grace' functions as the 'Object' being handed over, ensuring the story continues after the 'Subject' (preacher) exits.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the preacher's biography as a 'Secondary Program' that serves the 'Fundamental Program' of God's Word.
